Authors: K. P. Deepna Latha, P. Manimohan
Title: A new species of Inocybe from tropical India
Keywords:
Agaricales, Basidiomycota, Inocybaceae, Pseudosperma
clade, phylogeny, taxonomy
Abstract:
Inocybe griseorubida sp. nov. is described from Kerala
State, India. Comprehensive description, photographs, and comparisons
with phenetically similar species are provided. Nuclear ribosomal
internal transcribed spacer region (ITS), nuclear ribosomal large
subunit (nLSU) and the nuclear second-largest subunit of RNA polymerase
II (rpb2) gene of this species were sequenced and deposited in GenBank.
Phylogenetic analysis based on rpb2 sequences using maximum likelihood
(ML) method confirmed both the novelty of the species and its placement
within the Pseudosperma clade.
